thread.title: As California goes... But will nation follow state's lead on healthcare for immigrants?
thread.title_full: As California goes... But will nation follow state's lead on healthcare for immigrants?

title: As California goes... But will nation follow state's lead on healthcare for immigrants?
text:
02 As California goes... But will nation follow state's lead on healthcare for immigrants? 
Los Angeles Times: Like many blue states, California enthusiastically embraced Obamacare, signing up millions for health insurance. Now, it's venturing into a potentially costly and controversial new frontier of health policy: offering medical coverage to hundreds of thousands of people living in the country illegally.In a matter of months, the number of California counties committed to providing low-cost, government-run medical care to such residents jumped from 11 to 48. And in June, Gov. Jerry Brown signed a state budget that for the first time funds healthcare for such children.
